intro: Eriogonum proliferum, commonly known as the Sierra buckwheat, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Polygonaceae family and is characterized by its clustered, showy white or pinkish flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as meadows and rocky slopes. It has a compact, mat-like growth form with hairy stems and leaves. Eriogonum proliferum plays an important role in supporting local pollinators and wildlife in its native environment.
